Animist
  • About
  • Components
  • Use Cases
  • Contact

An open source project developing tools to enable location-aware Ethereum contracts.

Find Out More

Under construction Spring/Summer 2016

Components in development include mobile and IoT applications that can execute location contingent or proximity triggered contract clauses without requiring a user's intentional engagement, as well as an API to help people define and manage these on the Ethereum blockchain.

Components

Whale Island

An Ethereum node on a Rasberry Pi which broadcasts a persistant BLE beacon signal. This allows it to launch and connect to nearby Animist mobile clients even if they've been closed on their host device. A local Node.js server intermediates the mobile client and Ethereum, authenticating events and registering them with relevant contracts on the blockchain.

Wowshuxkluh

Javascript libraries for IOS and Android which let apps link an Ethereum account to IOT platforms that implement an Animist API. This allows developers to build seamless location-contingent value transfers into any mobile application. Additional modules enable contract semantics that incorporate sensor data collected from the mobile device.

Wallowa

Animist as an oracle on Ethereum: an API for Solidity that lets contracts be written around Animist proximity events and handles the mechanics of publishing these to the blockchain.

Wolves

An online tool to help translate natural language contract ideas into code that can be executed by Animist components on Ethereum. A Web UI that helps people build arbitrarily complex event specifications for real space and time that result in a contractual value exchange. A place to register and display Animist IOT assets and define the cost of using them.

Use case #1: Human Race

A mobile app for competitive running that pays

Two friends in New York who love to run decide to wager $20 on a foot race from the small bakery at 248 Broome Street in LES to the natural foods bodega across the Williamsburg Bridge at 282 Broadway. There's an app for that, called Human Race. Both locations host Animist enabled IOT nodes the app can tap into to detect their presence and execute conditional payment contracts on the Ethereum chain.

They meet at the bakery, eat a snack and register the bet through their phones. The app fires a starting shot. Whoever reaches the bodega first is detected by its Animist endpoint and gets the $20 virtual wager automatically transferred to their virtual account.

Human Race also permits side bets on this race in jurisdictions where casual betting is legal. It sets aside a portion of that betting pool for a jackpot awarded to the race winner. Maybe the winner gets more than $20! Maybe not. Depends on their social media connections to people in England.

Contact

Animist is on GitHub and actively seeking contributors. Feel free to fork the repo for any component you're interested in and make a pull request.
